match.title: 2nd Semi-final
match.statusText: India won by 9 wickets (with 59 balls remaining)
match.hoursInfo: 10:30 start, First Session 10:30-14:00 Interval 14:00-14:45, Second Session 14:45-18:15

headshotImage.caption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Jadhav 70 (82b 7x4 1x6 105m) SR: 85.36

dismissalComment.html: and Jadhav strikes. All those dots and Tamim is forced into a big shot. Straight and accurate from Jadhav, the length isn't full or short. But Tamim wants to hit through midwicket. He misses his slog sweep and the ball goes onto hit leg stump. Done in by pressure and Jadhav's length, not the right option, a cross-batted stroke to that ball

headshotImage.caption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Kohli b Jadhav 61 (85b 4x4 0x6 98m) SR: 71.76

dismissalComment.html: another one and Bangladesh are collapsing. So many dot balls, so much pressure. I'll release it all in one ball, says Mushfiqur to himself under his breath. So Mushfiqur thinks he can come down and swing. Jadhav tosses this up outside off, the ball dips late. Mushfiqur is too close to the ball, so decides to whip through midwicket, but it doesn't pitch. So he clips a full toss straight to midwicket, where Kohli won't drop them.

headshotImage.caption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and Jadhav strikes. All those dots and Tamim is forced into a big shot. Straight and accurate from Jadhav, the length isn't full or short. headshotImage.caption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: six down. That's excellent bowling from Bumrah. Hit the deck hard again, but this time he angled it into the batsman's body. Mosaddek looked to pull, but he was cramped for room and could only offer a return catch looped back off the high part of the bat, near the sticker
gone, that's deadly. Saw Mahmudullah stepping out and trying to make some room, and speared in the perfect yorker that sneaked under his bat and took out off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar b Kumar 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Not the greatest shot from Sarkar there. Length ball, angling away wide of off stump, and his front foot goes nowhere as he reaches out to drive. Plays with an angled bat, and can only chop it onto his stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Jadeja b Kumar 19 (21b 4x4 0x6 24m) SR: 90.47

dismissalComment.html: got him! Another slower ball, this one's shorter and much wider than the previous one. It took ages getting to Sabbir, begging him to go after it. He does, but in an effort to manufacture some power, fails to keep his cut down, and hits it straight to backward point

headshotImage.caption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kedar Jadhav player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Jadhav 70 (82b 7x4 1x6 105m) SR: 85.36

dismissalComment.html: and Jadhav strikes. All those dots and Tamim is forced into a big shot. Straight and accurate from Jadhav, the length isn't full or short. But Tamim wants to hit through midwicket. He misses his slog sweep and the ball goes onto hit leg stump. Done in by pressure and Jadhav's length, not the right option, a cross-batted stroke to that ball

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c †Dhoni b Jadeja 15 (23b 1x4 0x6 18m) SR: 65.21

dismissalComment.html: and the pressure is released in the form of another wicket. Short and wide outside off, the ball turns in. Too close to cut, Shakib goes back and tries to hit the gap in front of point but Jadeja's flat trajectory and angle (the ball spinning in) means it's not a high percentage stroke. The ball skids on with the arm and takes a thick edge. Quite a big deflection. But Dhoni's gloves are again in the right place and he nonchalantly makes an awfully tough catch look ridiculously simple. Toe end of the bat

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma not out 123 (129b 15x4 1x6 165m) SR: 95.34
Virat Kohli not out 96 (78b 13x4 0x6 96m) SR: 123.07

dismissalComment.html: somehow Dhawan chips his wicket away! It's yet another offcutter outside off, Dhawan shimmies down and looks to hit over mid-off but the ball skews off the outside half and goes towards point's left. That cut, off the ball, may have been the reason for the ball going to point, as opposed to mid-off.

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mosaddek Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Mosaddek Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 46 (34b 7x4 1x6 67m) SR: 135.29

dismissalComment.html: somehow Dhawan chips his wicket away! It's yet another offcutter outside off, Dhawan shimmies down and looks to hit over mid-off but the ball skews off the outside half and goes towards point's left. headshotImage.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: A two and a six gets Kohli 100, but I don't think he cares about it. Sabbir to continue. India one over away.

commentTextItems.html: and that will be it. Kohli finishes on 96. A very wide overpitched delivery that is crisply driven, one of many today, through cover for four. A punch of the air, more delight than annoyance. And India set up another blockbuster on Sunday with Pakistan to determine the winners of the 2017 Champions Trophy

commentPostTextItems.html: 5.10pm Clinical. From start to finish. Powerful. From beginning to end. And classy. India outlast and outclass Bangladesh in another one-sided semi-final, to give themselves a chance to defend their title on Sunday. Bangladesh can be proud of a terrific effort, they fought and scrapped through the tournament but were eventually done in by the quality of India. That's two let-downs of semi-finals, but that sets up one heck of a final, at least in foresight. In their chase of 265, they started well - solidly, putting the bad ball away. That's all they did through the afternoon, to be fair, and romped to a nine-wicket win.

Rohit Sharma is the Man of the Match: "Was a great knock, especially when it comes on a winning note. Trying to get a big one, in the last two games. Was quite determined today. Wicket was brilliant. I kept telling myself to bat as much as possible. We've been playing good cricket. One last hurdle, a big game against Pakistan. It felt like he was batting overnight (Virat Kohli). As a captain, he was brilliant."

Virat Kohli: "Another complete game. We needed to have a clean, collective game. We didn't expect to win by nine wickets, but that's the quality of our top order. He's not a surprise package (Kedar Jadhav), he's a smart guy, he knows where to pitch the ball and see what the wicket is offering. it could have been close to 300. I wanted to give myself some time, 10-15 balls. Last time, we lost a wicket, so I had to adapt, I like those challenges. I grew in confidence. When you're coming onto the short ball, you know you're playing well. We're taking it as any other game, I know that's boring but that's our mindset. Never a worry when your middle order isn't batting too much. Everyone is hitting the ball magnificently in practice."

Mashrafe Mortaza: "We could have scored 300, even 320, but our set batsmen getting out was a setback to us. Next time, we'll come back strongly. We need to learn. Skill-wise we're fine, but mentally we need to be stronger."
Don't forget, it's Rahul Dravid who will join Shaun Tait and Ajit Agarkar in Match Day. Homepage, top-right corner of this page (desktop), take your pick. Tune in.
For those not on a desktop, you can watch Match Day, featuring Rahul Dravid, on our Facebook page.

commentTextItems.html: Kohli goes deep in the crease and meets the straight ball with an angled bat, gets one to square leg
87 kph, on the pads, pushed away to long-on.
on the pads, nudged away to deep square leg. Easy as ...

commentPreTextItems.html: Ahan: "Kohli quickest to 8000 runs.........yet another record that will soon be broken by Hashim Amla"

commentTextItems.html: punched away off the back foot to the sweeper cover. One more.
quick on middle, pushed to long-off

commentPreTextItems.html: Right then. 11 more for Kohli, India need 9
Virat Kohli has broken AB de Villiers' record for fastest to 8000 ODI runs.

commentTextItems.html: flat and wide outside off, guided to third man
oh yes. Flat on off, pushed back to the bowler. Well played Rohit
quick on off, Kohli goes back and pushes to long-on
on middle and leg, nudged to square leg. Well done by Rohit
punched to long-off for a run. Kohli is the quickest ODI batsman to 8000 runs
flat and wide, left alone this time
drops short filth. On middle and leg, a donkey drop. And Kohli pulls through midwicket for four. Absolute tripe

commentPreTextItems.html: Brutus_Shylock: "@Ankush Kohli always had a majestic record in ODIs in England. It was the test match record he talked about. Still a bit of time to go for that, 2018 we shall see. "

commentTextItems.html: enough of prodding and plodding. Flat and wide outside off, Rohit brings out an IPL drive, lofting the ball powerfully over cover for another boundary.
overpitched on leg, driven to long-off for a single.
drifts on the pads and Kohli says thanks. Just a bit of bat is all he needed, to fine leg, another boundary
tossed up with a round-arm action on leg, defended
quicker, straighter and fuller. Rohit cuts and finds the gap in front of point for a run
short and very wide and very very slow. Cut but finds point

commentPreTextItems.html: "Whatever happens in Edgbaston today, India already has a big winner. Twenty-four-year-old HS Prannoy pulled off a huge upset at the Indonesia Open, beating World No.3 Lee Chong Wei 21-10, 21-18, though Prannoy himself is playing it cool."

commentTextItems.html: fullish outside off, Kohli mis-times one. Back up the pitch via the pad

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli not out 96 (78b 13x4 0x6 96m) SR: 123.07

headshotImage.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: somehow Dhawan chips his wicket away! It's yet another offcutter outside off, Dhawan shimmies down and looks to hit over mid-off but the ball skews off the outside half and goes towards point's left. That cut, off the ball, may have been the reason for the ball going to point, as opposed to mid-off.

It's yet another offcutter outside off, Dhawan shimmies down and looks to hit over mid-off but the ball skews off the outside half and goes towards point's left. That cut, off the ball, may have been the reason for the ball going to point, as opposed to mid-off.

stories.title: India thrive on boring but effective template
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy 2017, 2nd semi-final, Edgbaston

image.longCaption: Jasprit Bumrah completes the return catch of Mosaddek Hossain, Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy 2017, Edgbaston, June 15, 2017

stories.title: Bangladesh's shaky batting edifice strains under pressure
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy, 2nd semi-final, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh's shaky batting edifice strains under pressure
stories.summary: Bangladesh's batting rests on four players - Tamim Iqbal, Mushfiqur Rahim, Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah - but in the absence of performances on other players, the pressure on them has been immense

image.caption: Soumya Sarkar was bowled in the first over
image.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar was bowled in the first over, Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy 2017, Edgbaston, June 15, 2017

stories.title: Kohli fastest to 8000 ODI runs

stories.seoTitle: Virat Kohli fastest to 8000 ODI runs
stories.summary: The India captain took seven innings fewer than AB de Villiers to get to the landmark

image.caption: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma embrace after India completed the win
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma embrace after India completed the win, Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy 2017, Edgbaston, June 15, 2017

stories.title: Jadhav teases Bangladesh into a trap
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy, 2nd semi-final, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Kedar Jadhav teases Bangladesh into a trap
stories.summary: A cameo and shoddy fielding is all he had to show for his efforts coming into the semi-final. On Thursday, his slow, skiddy offspin triggered a Bangladesh slide

image.caption: Kedar Jadhav broke a 123-run third-wicket stand between Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur Rahim
image.longCaption: Kedar Jadhav broke a 123-run third-wicket stand between Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur Rahim, Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy 2017, Edgbaston, June 15, 2017

stories.title: Dominant India march into yet another final
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy, 2nd semi-final, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Dominant India march into yet another final
stories.summary: The best team at ICC events since 2010 marched into its fourth final in seven tournaments to set up a summit clash against Pakistan, pitting the tournament's best bowling sides against each other

image.caption: Kedar Jadhav broke a 123-run third-wicket stand between Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur Rahim
image.longCaption: Kedar Jadhav broke a 123-run third-wicket stand between Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur Rahim, Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy 2017, Edgbaston, June 15, 2017

stories.title: India facing a 'changed Bangladesh'
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy semi-final, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Mashrafe Mortaza talks of India facing a 'changed Bangladesh'
stories.summary: Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza has said that wins against top teams over the last couple of years has helped them gain self-respect and play with a lot more freedom

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza roars after dismissing Danushka Gunathilaka
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza roars after dismissing Danushka Gunathilaka, Sri Lanka v Bangladesh, 2nd ODI, Dambulla, March 28, 2017

stories.title: What's the secret of Dhawan's big-event mastery?
stories.subTitle: Champions Trophy 2017
stories.seoTitle: What's the secret of Shikhar Dhawan's big-event mastery?
stories.summary: A couple of subtle technical adjustments, allied to his ever-present qualities of heart, temperament and clarity of mind, have brought the India opener a bucketload of runs in yet another ICC ODI tournament

image.caption: Shikhar Dhawan keeps a close eye on the ball
image.longCaption: Shikhar Dhawan keeps a close eye on the ball , India v Pakistan, Champions Trophy, Group B, Birmingham, June 4, 2017

stories.title: Tactics Board: How Bangladesh can beat India
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy semi-final, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Tactics Board: How Bangladesh can beat India
stories.summary: Bangladesh have not beaten India in a global tournament since that famous win in 2007. We take a look at how they could halt India's run

image.caption: Except for Tamim Iqbal, Bangladesh's top order has been jittery so far this Champions Trophy
image.longCaption: Except for Tamim Iqbal, Bangladesh's top order has been jittery so far this Champions Trophy

stories.title: 'I did like to be portrayed as a fighter'
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy semi-final, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: 'I did like to be portrayed as a fighter' - Yuvraj Singh
stories.summary: Over a 17-year-career, Yuvraj Singh has battled dips in form, made numerous comebacks, and even survived cancer. On the eve of his 300th ODI, he spoke about his learnings from the game

image.caption: Yuvraj Singh took on the short balls
image.longCaption: Yuvraj Singh took on the short balls, India v Pakistan, Champions Trophy, Group B, Birmingham, June 4, 2017

stories.title: Unfinished business on Bangladesh's minds
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, Champions Trophy semi-final, Edgbaston
stories.summary: Having pushed India hard in the 2015 World Cup quarter-finals and come agonisingly close to a win in the 2016 World T20, can Bangladesh complete the job in their maiden ICC tournament semi-final?

image.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman pulled off a diving catch at short fine leg to dismiss Ross Taylor, New Zealand v Bangladesh, Group A, Champions Trophy 2017, Cardiff, June 9, 2017
